drupalNodeEvent.title: Southeast Asia in the Global Order

field_speakers.processed:
Bilahari Kausikan, Former Permanent Secretary of Singapore's Ministry of Foreign Affairs; Former Singapore Ambassador to the United Nations and Russia


Moderator: Richard Yarrow, Mossavar-Rahmani Center for Business and Government, Harvard University

drupalNodeEvent.field_event_venue: On Zoom and in person at CGIS South, Harvard University, Cambridge, MA

field_description.processed:
During his nearly four decades in Singapore’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Bilahari Kausikan represented the Southeast Asian state at the UN, Russia, Canada, and as an Ambassador at Large, and served as the Ministry's Permanent Secretary.

Kausikan will discuss Southeast Asia’s role in the global order and how the region is misunderstood internationally. Addressing misperceptions of the region is important for understanding Southeast Asia’s responses to some of the great global tensions and geopolitical shifts of the present, from U.S.-China tensions to conflicts in Europe and the Middle East. Kausikan will also discuss how Southeast Asia's actions could serve as models for other regions.
